reviewText: Viewed: 9/10Rate: 39/10: Repossessed is a terribly made spoof of the horror classic The Exorcist. So many of the "jokes" fell flat before making to the finish line, I was compelled to take few interspersed breaks to rest my brain from premature decay. A couple were funny, but let's be real...the movie was as bad as Airplane! or National Lampoon's Loaded Weapon 1. I see that Linda Blair has decided to be a sell-out and cash in her fame for her work in The Exorcist when in fact it wasn't really her in the movie; most of the work was actually done by Mercedes McCambridge. What's Ned Beatty doing in this uber trash? He used to do much better films and was too good for Repossessed. Leslie Nielsen is boring as heck and fails again as usual. I've never liked his work before. What's with the many political moments of 80s? Overdone and bad comedy. Too many bad sex jokes...and overdone also. Try be subtle, please. Use dry humor more often. The worst of all about the movie is the incessant use of the green pea vomit. I know it was done in the classic, but must we need be subject to the sight repeatedly? Enough is enough. All in all, Repossessed...consider yourself accursed.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Repossessed is a satire movie starring Linda Blair and Leslie Nielsen. This has to be one of the worst movies that I have tried to watch in the last 5 years. The jokes are lame, the acting is on autopilot and the storyline is just downright horrible. The special effects look cheap and I first thought I was watching a movie from the early 80's. I wrote tried to watch since after 30 minutes I felt I had wasted time in my life that I would never get back. Definitely not recommended. 1/5.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'd compare this movie favorably to "The Naked Gun" and "Airplane!" and their sequels. There were many funny scenes and a few flops which is par for the course with most of Leslie Nielsen's movies. Repossessed, however, had more potential than the others and it could have been the best of Nielson's parodies if more time had been taken to develop the material. The movie is uneven, but there are moments where it is incredibly funny. The boy with all the PMS jokes was certainly a high-point that should have been exploited a little more (even if those jokes are politically incorrect). (Come to think of it, the little brother in "Not Another Teen Movie" is very similar to this character.) The jabs at the television evangelicists were pretty funny too. In fact, the material which strayed the furthest from The Exorcist theme was probably the strongest. I'd say that this movie is definately worth watching, BUT it could have been SO much better! It's still a better than average movie and is worth about three and a half stars on a five star scale!
Title: N/A

reviewText: While not exactly on the same level of quality as the "Naked Gun" movies, REPOSSESSED does provide Leslie Nielsen with an entertaining role as Father Jebedaiah Mayii, the priest who must once again rid Linda Blair ("The Exorcist") of demonic possession.Ordinary housewife Nancy Aglet (Linda Blair) starts spewing green split-pea soup, but the jury's out on whether she's been repossessed or suffering PMS.  When a pair of Jim & Tammy Bakker clones (Ned Beatty and Lana Schwab) decides to air Nancy's exorcism live on TV, Father Mayii (Leslie Nielsen), with the help of young priest Father Brophy (Anthony Starke) must once again battle the demonic devils of darkness...but can they crack the ratings in the process?It runs out of steam towards the end but the movie still holds up well.  Leslie Nielsen adds his talent and good-humoured comedy to the role of Mayii and does a fantastic job; and Linda Blair pokes fun at her "Exorcism" fame.  Some of the jokes (and fashions) have dated horribly, but REPOSSESSED will still provide plenty of giggles.
summary: "Luke, remember, when you fall on your face you're still moving forward"
Title: N/A

reviewText: Linda Blair stars as the happy-go-lucky housewife Nancy Aglet who falls back under the devil's spell and becomes REPOSSESSED! Now, Father Mayii must come back out of retirement if he hopes to save her soul for good. If you thought Elvira's puns were bad, you ain't seen nothing yet! REPOSSESSED hits the bottom of the barrel when it comes to horror comedies. It is an agonizingly unfunny spoof of THE EXORCIST that reaches for the same style of inane humor found in the AIRPLANE or THE NAKED GUN films, but comes up desperately short. Leslie Nielsen returns as another naive and nitwitted character, garnering very few laughs as he stumbles through one ill-conceived set-up after another. Director Bob Logan attempts to poke fun at everything from televangelists to fitness clubs(?), and can never seem to pick a solid direction for the film to follow. With nowhere left to go, we end on a televised exorcism which includes a musical number where Nielsen impersonates everyone from Michael Jackson to Elton John, badly. At least Linda Blair can take a joke as she playfully parodies herself as Nancy. All of the expected pea-spitting and head-spinning jokes remain faithfully intact, and as idiotic as it truly is, EXORCIST fans are sure to find some guilty pleasure in watching.-Carl ManesI Like Horror Movies
Title: N/A

reviewText: Thid film purports to be a sendup of "The Exorcist" but in essence it's a litany of Eighties pop culture.  You may chuckle if you are of a certain age but ultimately it undermines the whole enterprise.  The makers throw at you everything and the kitchen sink and some of it works but mostly it falls flat.  All is not lost, however.  Leslie Nielsen is his unflappable best as the exorcist and Linda Blair is terrific sending up her Regan role.  I especially liked the running commentary of Jesse Ventura and "Mean Gene" Okerlund during the exorcism.  Not particularly memorable but not particularly good either.
summary: Jesse "The Body" Ventura To "Body By Jake" Steinfeld

reviewText: I just got done watching this movie and what a disappointment. I think the problem is they makers could not decide whether this is a Nielsen or Blair movie. The movie ends up being about neither one. Neither very scary nor that funny.I got it because of Nielsen because I love his acting. I have got his stuff from Forbidden Planet all the way to Naked Gun series and more. I wanted funny! It has its funny moments but for most part it padded with "filler". The first third was slow; boring and not that funny. Then it got better as there was more of Nielsen. Then it goes down in the final third. Basically the good parts are a direct function of having Nielsen. The rest you might as well skip. It seems like they went cheap on the movie and instead of 100% Nielsen we get about 1/3. The padding is done by a whole lot of second rate music video. They should remove the fillers; and make it half as long then it will go up a few stars.

reviewText: It works for me.This is a very dated comedy but it is good for a few laughs from those who might remember the cultural references. The emphasis is on "a few laughs". This movie certainly does not live up to the standard set by the NAKED GUN series or to that set by AIRPLANE. That's sad since it is from the same source and Leslie Nielsen plays the lead.The story is of an exorcist who has gone into retirement after his last successful exorcism of a young girl. Many years later, that girl, now a woman, is repossessed while watching TV. The exorcist is reluctant to come out of retirement and tries to delegate the work to a young priest. The priest winds up getting help from a televangelist at first and then just about every other religious figure imaginable after that. Finally, it is the old exorcist who must save the day.This show is filled to the brim with lowbrow comedy and sight gags. It is also full of pop and political cultural references from the era in which it was made. If you remember these, you will get a bit more out of it. It also helps to have seen the original EXORCIST.This is not great comedy but it was somewhat amusing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love these kind of movies (with the expolsuin of Fatal Instinct)Repossessed is both a whacky, slappy and goofey comedy and also an un-offical sequl to The Excorsist. The same woman who played Regan Teresa MacNeil(Linda Blair) in "The Excorcist"(1973) returns to play the same charactor in this hillarious comedy but named Nancy Aglet.She is now all grown up and has a husband and 2 kids and one night she is starting to be possessed again. With some help from a preist Father Luke Brophy (Peter Green) they track down Father Mayii (Leslie Neilson) who is playing the priest who is supposed to have preformed the exorcisim years ago in the Exorcist movie.A lot of zaney things happen along the way. A lot of whacky comedy and slapstick humour. If you cant laugh during this movie, check into the morgue and choose a cooler to lay in till your wake-end.A few fammiluer faces along the way, Linda Blair, Ned Beatty, Leslie Nielsen, Anthony Starke, Thom Sharp, Lana Schwab ,Benj Thall, Dove Dellos, Jacquelyn Masche, Melissa Moore, Willie Garson, Erna Gregory, Richard Halpern, Carol Shermer, Kathy Topia ...moreIf you liked movies like Airplane/Flying High, Naked Gun, Hot Shots, Spaceballs, Kentucky Fried Movie, Scary Movie, Loaded Weopen 1, Silence Of The Hams, I know what you did last friday the 13th then you should enjoy Repossessed.
summary: Is she possessed or is it PMS????

reviewText: If it weren't for the fact that whoever wrote this script was extremely talented, this movie would have been depressingly terrible.  The acting in this movie suffers from... well, it just suffers.  Leslie Nielson does a decent job as a retired exorcist while the other unknowns in this movie simply seem to be along for the ride.  Linda Blair does a great Satan, but she isn't at all humorous, and the guy who plays the young priest isn't even worth attention (except for the fact that he has some nice lines).  The female TV evangelist does a great job of being a total ditz, but she also isn't really worthy of much notice.Fortunately enough, the script's jokes rely mostly upon Nielson or prop jokes, allowing the viewers to ignore the lousy acting.  Blair also has some nice lines, and delivers them well, although most of them simply involve mimicking another show or movie (Barbara Walters, "They're here." From Poltergeist).Overall a really good movie if you've seen every other available Nielson video, but definitely not his best.  I guess the children  weren't the only ones who needed the acting lessons.

reviewText: Some scripts look good on paper, but when they are made into movies, it becomes obvious they should not have been made. This movie is one example, and despite superlative efforts on the part of Leslie Nielsen, the movie is below expectations we should have for a movie with Leslie Nielsen in it. Thus I cannot in good conscience recommend it.Roy M. Raffield
summary: Movie Smells Like Regurgitated Split Pea Soup

reviewText: I saw this after Scary Movie2, and decided this was much funnier, Linda Blair spoofing the role she's most known for was a good casting choice. The Exorcist jokes are well done for their time, alot of them are alot like Mel Brooks directing style. Leslie Nielsen does a great take on Max VonSydow's charecter. Underneath the humor though, there is a reference to religious fanatacism, and it also pokes fun at so-called preachers who are more in the business for the money than salvation.This film isn't laugh a minute funny, but it does have quite a few hilarious scenes and anyone who's familiar with Exorcist will know them instantly. To enjoy this film you don't need to be overtly familiar with the source material, but it doesn't hurt.
summary: Leslie Nielsen, your acting style still works
